job_description:
Greater Vancouver Area
Full-time
Role description:
Supporting and delivering projects in SAP Time and Payroll including hands-on support and development. The successful candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Functional post-implementation production support.
Acted as a liaison between the project team and the business process owner(s).
Participate in strategy discussions and decisions related to Time, Payroll and other HR/Finance functions; Facilitate group discussions related to business process improvement planning or new processes.
Maintain functional design documents.
Develop, document and maintain functional requirements for subsequent technical development.
Coordinate with the Training and Change Management Teams on creating and maintaining training materials and providing training to end-users; Coordinate and manage the integration of Payroll.
Qualification and Experience Requirements:
Minimum of 5 years’ SAP HCM experience in Time/Payroll.
Experience with integration of HCM with other modules such as FI/CO, PS, PM, SD and PP.
Excellent English communication skills both verbal and written.
Ability to work well independently.
Demonstrated positive attitude, integrity, teamwork, and problem-solving.
SAP HCM certification preferred

Organizations across the globe rely on OneSource Virtual for Workday services, support, optimization , and consulting. We create solutions built on the Workday application that empower customers to become strategic HR organizations , then scales with them as they grow. To date, OneSource Virtual offers HR outsourcing, IT outsourcing, application optimization , and consulting services to 500+ customers that represent more than 35 percent of Workday’s customer base.
The Workday HCM Implementation Consultant will be responsible for the successful implementation of the Workday solution for key accounts. The position will work with the Engagement Manager and Client to ensure that system and business requirements are clearly defined, documented, communicated, implemented and tested.
Responsibilities
° Identify and analyze business needs and requirements.
° Create and develop functional designs and specifications.
° Analyze gaps and complete fit gap documentation.
° Lead the Workday implementation process from start to finish.
° Facilitate requirements gathering, design, tenant review and other customer facing sessions, as required.
° Perform testing, deployment systems integration, including, testing, and executing the pilot/implementation/ deployment of new or enhanced hardware or software.
° Setting up and using project management processes/systems across work streams including planning of life cycle of the project, identifying key project activities and milestones, etc.
° Consulting with clients on a variety of data integrity issues and leading business practices utilizing Workday.
° Conducting product fit analysis.
° Engage with client project managers, defining client strategies and requirements, guiding clients through the implementation process, configuring the application according to customer requirements, developing system interface and data conversion plans.
° Ensure delivery of high-quality services and products to clients.
° Work with client to identify/resolve all issues that could impact project scope and/or timeframe.
° Ensure client takes advantage of Workday system.
Requirements
° Business Degree in Management or Management of Information Systems required.
° Workday Certification in HCM preferred. If not already certified, certification in HCM will be required within 60 days of hire
° Previous experience working with either Workday, PeopleSoft or other ERP HR/Payroll systems/applications.
° 5+ years’ experience implementing HCM or supporting HCM operations in mid-market organizations.
° Possess an advanced knowledge of IT design principles, practices, and theory by providing guidance to others in functional design processes and completing functional HR/HCM design docs.
° Consulting experience either as an internal consultant or with a software consulting company.
° Ability to develop complex functional designs, including options for technical platforms.
° Working knowledge and language of the following business areas: Human Resources, Benefits, and Payroll.
° Candidate should be able to collaborate with customers to define deployment expectations and ensure consistency with strategic direction.
° Ability to coach others in the execution of the testing, piloting, installation, and implementation activities on schedule and within budget, providing expertise when needed.
° Candidate must be organized, detail-oriented, and have strong written and verbal communication skills.
° Previous experience with a major systems integrator and/or an enterprise software company a plus.
° Passion for customer service.
° Travel 30%
POSITION WILL BE LOCATED IN CANADA
You are encouraged to learn and share ideas when you join the OneSource Virtual team. We reward innovative thinking, fresh perspectives, creative collaboration , and hard work. As an organization experienc ing routine strategic growth, we are always on the lookout for intelligent, talented , and forward-thinking professionals to join our team. OSV employees enjoy a values-based culture, upward mobility , and professional development with opportunities of all kinds.

job_title: Delivery Consultant – HCM Time & Labor / Absence Management
job_description:
Delivery Consultant – HCM Time & Labor / Absence Management-20000C9N

Preferred Qualifications

The Oracle Cloud HCM Absence Consultant will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of the Oracle’s Fusion solution.
As the Senior Consultant, you will work with your clients to understand their business processes, provide solutions based in product and consultative expertise and drive adoption of Oracle’s modern best practices processes.

Key Areas of Responsibility
Lead business process workshops and advise client on the impacts of adopting the Oracle Cloud Absence Management solution
Lead requirements gathering sessions and support clients in defining relevant processes and obtain sign off to ensure client alignment of proposed solution
Understand Oracle’s Implementation Methodology and use it on all engagements
Configure the Oracle HCM Cloud Absence Management solution
Conduct process familiarization workshops to demonstrate the configuration of the cloud solution
Support the client during all phases of testing, production cutover and post go live
Supporting the data migration consulting team and/or client with any data migration efforts
Assist the integration consulting team in helping to build, configure and test integrations between HCM and third party/custom solutions
Complete the client work on time and on budget
Mentor and review work of junior team members

Knowledge Base / Skills
An ideal candidate must have full life cycle implementation of atleast two Absence HCM Cloud implementations
Experience implementing Oracle HCM Cloud solution
Previous consulting experience with a consulting/software company
Experience in implementing HCM SaaS applications
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Business analysis and requirements gathering abilities
Experience with multiple HCM applications a plus
Ability to travel up to 70% of the time if needed

Due to the nature of the clients and the work, US Citizens and Green Card Holders (GC) / EAD only - no work sponsorships are available currently.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veteran’s status or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Oracle, we don’t just value differences—we celebrate them. We’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people work together. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion.

https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/culture/diversity.html

(JoinNAAC-DlvExc)

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
An experienced consulting professional who has a broad understanding of solutions, industry best practices, multiple business processes or technology designs within a product/technology family. Operates independently to provide quality work products to an engagement. Performs varied and complex duties and tasks that need independent judgment, in order to implement Oracle products and technology to meet customer needs. Applies Oracle methodology, company procedures, and leading practices.

Operates independently to provide quality work products to an engagement. Performs varied and complex duties and tasks that need independent judgment, in order to implement Oracle products and technology to meet customer needs. Applies Oracle methodology, company procedures, and leading practices. Demonstrates expertise to deliver functional and technical solutions on moderately complex customer engagements. May lead the solution design and implementation aspects of engagement(s) ensuring high quality, integrated software solutions within constraints of time and budget. May act as the team lead on projects, providing coaching, guidance and feedback to develop skills of team members. Effectively consults with management of customer organizations. Participates in business development activities. Develops and leads detailed solutions for moderately complex projects.

6-8 years of experience relevant to this position including 3-4 years consulting experience preferred. Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred. Product or technical expertise relevant to practice focus. Ability to communicate effectively. Ability to build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed.

Job Brief
Oracle Cloud HCM Technical Consultant
Oracle Technical Consultant
Service Line: Oracle HCM
Location: Multiple Opportunities in multiple locations

Position Summary
Oracle Cloud HCM Technical Consultant
In this role you will be responsible for providing Oracle Cloud HCM expertise by acting as a subject matter expert / provide expertise through system implementation / upgrade(s) and Oracle HCM product knowledge. You will work on all project phases including fit/gap, configuration /design, testing and cutover.
What you will do
Assist and/or lead clients in fully integrating the HCM system into their current business environments / enable updated business processes / provide input on best practices / lessons learned from prior implementations / upgrades, and advise the business on options, risks, and any impacts on other processes or systems.
As an Oracle Cloud HCM Technical Consultant:
Your Responsibilities
Demonstrate strong understanding of business processes
Demonstrate good understanding of client business operations or needs
Demonstrate good understanding and knowledge to innovate and make business processes more efficient
Research legislative/ regulatory rules and policies to provide relevant and timely support / expertise to the business, along with articulating to the clients
Provide subject matter expertise in one or more specific areas or modules within Oracle Cloud HCM
Lead project teams in delivering rapid Implementations
Lead and participate in continuous development and internal IP Accelerator program
Participate and provide technical expertise during functional design session
Assist with estimation of time required for technical design and build
Provides guidance and assist with documentation of technical design
Experience with full implementation and production support
Provides walkthrough of technical design
Conduct Unit testing of the development
Documents Migration procedure and assists with troubleshooting issues
Provide knowledge transfer to peers / client counterparts
Supports through Integration and Acceptance testing
Advises on options, risks, and any impacts on other processes or systems
Complete tasks efficiently and in a timely manner
Report progress to teams and project managers
Continually seek ways to improve the process of delivering HCM Cloud solutions
Share knowledge to continually improve implementation methodology
Participate in Talent Sourcing and Recruiting activities
Work closely with Senior Managers, Directors and Partners in practice development activities
Qualifications Required:
7+ years of professional services experience with ERP’s Oracle Cloud HCM, EBS HCM
Experience in delivering Oracle HCM Cloud projects and must have completed at least 2 Full cycle Oracle HCM Cloud implementations
Experience working with Oracle Cloud/Fusion HCM modules - Payroll and Benefits.
Technical knowledge of Oracle HCM data loaders, spreadsheet loaders, BI Publisher, HDL, OTB, write interface code, HCM Extract, personalization, configurations, checklists, reports, fast formulas
Strong Implementation skills as a Technical SME
Experience configuring at least 2 modules – Payroll, Benefits, Talent management, Global HR, Benefits, Absence, Performance, Goal Management modules
Experience Integrating HCM Cloud with ERP, and/or Benefits Carriers/TBE/TEE/Job Boards
In-depth understanding of how to plan, assist and deliver migration of customers data, business processes from On-Premise to Oracle HCM Cloud

Education/Training Required:
Certified in Oracle HCM Cloud

Preferred:
Ability to work on all project phases
3+ years of working with a consulting organization
Strong adaptability to new delivery techniques and tools are preferred
Strong commitment to professional and client service
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Strong adaptability to new delivery techniques and tools are preferred
North American experience
Environmental considerations Required:
Flexible to travel (30% and/or as required)
Flexible with working hours/structure as indicative of project/client assignment(s)

What you bring to the team:
Collaborator
Open to change
Deep Thinker

How you will grow
At EAinfobiz, our development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. We offer opportunities to sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the Global landscape. Our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At EAinfobiz, we know that great people make an incredible organization. Our benefits are among the best, not just within our industry, they are also competitive in most industry sectors and all benefits are effective on day one of joining our team.

EAInfobiz Culture
Our culture inspires teamwork and learning from one another. It cultivates core skills, but celebrates individuality.
We believe in teaching moments as we work our way through the projects.
Our Leadership team is committed to creating an exciting culture focused on integrity, prioritizing client needs and nurturing exciting careers for each of our employees.
EAInfoBiz is a learning organization built on the premise that our employees can add value from day one.

Introduction
As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Global Business Services (GBS) helps our clients fundamentally redesign experiences to create new sources of value, digitally reinvent their operations for great efficiency and transform their entire enterprises through cognitive. We invite you to consider joining IBM's global reach, outcome-focused methodologies, domain skills and deep industry expertise that are helping transform the way we live and work.
IBM's state-of-the-art Client Innovation Centre (CIC) opened in Nova Scotia in March 2013 and is the first of its kind in Canada. The Centre weaves together IBM’s business insights and industry-leading software portfolio and is ideally suited for any client that needs flexible access to emerging or niche skills that may not be cost effective to grow internally. In addition, our focus on our team is unparalleled as demonstrated by the following:
The CIC NS is one of IBM’s highest performing delivery centres worldwide – for retention, client satisfaction and utilization. Our employees are empowered to stay and grow within IBM.
We are very focused on continuous skill development – staff training is our third largest annual Centre investment. Employees are immersed in a culture of learning and constant growth.
Investment in key partnership with universities, government and private sector groups which has resulted in IBM having a key influencing role in Nova Scotia’s ICT industry, especially in talent development.
We are currently recruiting for top talent in SAP Practice - If you are on top of your profession and possess the following key skills, we invite you to apply to our openings of a Senior HCM Time Consultant:

Your responsibilities will include:
Conducting Fit/Gap analysis and business /process modeling
Assessing the business and application requirements
Designing robust business processes considering accepted industry practices
Configuring and testing the software
Driving the development of functional and systems specifications
Writing and maintaining necessary documentation
Actively performing knowledge transfer to client team members
Communicate and work with people of all levels in a team environment
Provide support to deployment as necessary
Mandatory Qualification
6+ years of SAP HCM Time management
Module skills might include personnel administration, recruitment, organizational management, personnel development, health and safety, training & events, payroll, time management, compensation management, portal, or self-service.
Have completed a minimum of 3 full life cycle implementation of SAP
Strong ability to understand and analyze HR management process
Customer service-oriented and excellent interpersonal skills
Proven ability to adapt to changing environments and demonstrate sound judgment in the face of complex challenges
Ability to work under pressure on simultaneous assignments
Demonstrated project management experience is an asset
Previous consulting experience is an asset
Must be located on-site at IBM office in Bedford, NS.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise
At least 6 years of SAP HCM Time management

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
N/A

About Business Unit
IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter business by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

We are constantly seeking Senior SAP HCM Consultants for short and long term contract projects with our organization.
As a Senior Consultant you will be involved in all aspects of the implementation cycle including participation in the design of business process requirements, blueprinting, realization, testing, documentation and post go-live support of the SAP HR software module. You must be a strong SAP-HR certified consultant with at least 5 years of experience and a minimum of 3 full cycle implementations. Strong oral and written communication, teamwork and analytical skills are also required. The ability to travel is also a requirement.

If you feel you meet these requirements, please submit a detail resume with a list of implementation cycles for consideration to:

Career@papins.com

job_title: Oracle HCM Cloud Time & Labour Consultant
job_description:
Cloudworks is a leading cloud technology consulting firm supporting clients’ transitions to Cloud-based technologies, empowered by Robotic Process Automation. From strategy to execution we help organizations realize the art of possible by providing executable strategy, operations, technology, and advisory services. We provide advisory through end‑to‑end implementation services and are recognized in the marketplace for Cloud and RPA technology leadership.

Our experienced technology professionals offer deep technical experience in their area of focus and are committed to delivering efficient, technology-based solutions to our clients. Additionally, our professionals invest in our Clients’ success and the development of leading-edge RPA usage cases, improving our ability to tailor solutions to solve our Clients' business issues.

Why work with us

People

We are passionate about fostering a culture where people thrive. Our hiring process is very thorough to help ensure potential candidates are top talent, a good fit, and giving candidates a chance to understand if Cloudworks is a right fit for them too!

Teamwork

We strongly believe in the power of success through teamwork. Working at Cloudworks you will feel an integral part of a high-performing team where all team members are accountable to each other. Together we support but also push each other achieve great results for our clients.

Investment

Unlike many consulting companies which rely on a semi-annual or annual performance review cycle, we believe in investing in our staff through feedback which happens much more in real-time. We seek to help everyone understand and develop their strengths and capabilities, relying on an individual’s own motivations to drive results.

Oracle HCM Cloud Time & Labour Consultant

As an Oracle Time & Labour Consultant, you will be responsible for leading and managing the end to end implementation for Oracle’s Time & Labour module for our clients.

Work you’ll do

As a Gold-level member of the Oracle Partner Network and an Oracle Cloud Excellence Implementer (CEI), Cloudworks needs strong professionals like yourself to help pave the way for our clients and our Cloud service line development. For our clients, our Oracle Cloud professionals reduce cost and support innovation at the enterprise level by managing business requirements and leading the functional design, prototyping, and process design stages of Oracle Cloud implementations. Responsibilities will include:

Client Management: Manage day‑to‑day interactions with project managers, and team members
Delivery: Manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Responsibilities include, among others, identification of business requirements, functional design, process design, prototyping, testing, training, and providing post-go-live support for Oracle’s Time & Labor module.
Business Development: Develop and maintain contact with decision makers at key clients; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.
People Development: Perform role of mentor; provide input and guidance into the staffing process; actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities; provide leadership and support for delivery team members and staff.
Eminence: Develop thought leadership to share insights and points of view with existing and potential clients.

Qualifications

For this role, we are looking for candidates who are able to:

Provide Oracle HCM Cloud functional/technical consulting services by acting as a subject matter expert and leading clients through the entire cloud application services implementation lifecycle for Oracle’s Time & labour module
Identify business requirements and map them to the Oracle Time & labour functionality
Conduct Functional/Technical Design Workshops for Oracle Time & labour projects
Identify functionality gaps in Oracle Time & labor, and build extensions for them
Advise client on options, risks, and any impacts on other processes or systems
Configure the Oracle Time & labour application to meet client requirements and document application set-ups
Write business requirement documents for reports, interfaces, data conversions, and application extensions for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Develop Security and Validation Strategies & Plans for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Assist client in preparing validation scripts, testing scenarios, and develop test scripts for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Support clients with the execution of test scripts
Validate configuration and data for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Lead migration of configuration, integrations, and extensions to Production for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Effectively communicate and drive project deliverables for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Complete tasks efficiently and in a timely manner
Interact with the project team members responsible for developing reports, interfaces, data conversion programs, and application extensions
Provide status and issue reports to the project manager/client on a regular basis
Share knowledge to continually improve implementation methodology for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Work on Rel 12 and upwards
Access and assess impacts on Oracle’s quarterly release

Required

Functional professional with 2+ Oracle HCM Cloud Time & labor implementations
Minimum 2-3 years of experience implementing Time & Labour and Absence Management Oracle HCM Modules
Knowledge of Oracle HCM Modules such as HR, Benefits, Payroll, Talent Management, Learning, and Recruiting considered an asset
Demonstrated experience as an experienced resource leading in the definition of systems strategy, gathering, and documenting business requirements, leading fit-gap analysis, as‑is and to‑be business process designs, prototypes, functional configuration, testing, and client user training
Experience reporting to senior client contacts, managing client teams, in addition to on- and off‑site, and off‑shore functional and technical teams
Must have experience collaborating with clients on business process enhancements
Limited Travel Required (Project Milestone Travel)
A Bachelor’s degree

Preferred

Lead experience on complex, international, multi-currency, and multi-organization implementations
5+ years of consulting experience which includes: contributing to requests for proposals (RFP), client presentations, detailing the scope of work (SOW)
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments within a structured implementation methodology
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, etc.)
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Commitment to gaining exposure in multiple industries
Experience mentoring junior staff
An advanced degree or certification in the area of specialization
One full lifecycle implementations of Oracle HCM Cloud, eBusiness Suite

Location

Our offices are located in Toronto and Calgary, but we are open to candidates from across Canada and the U.S.

We thank all applicants; however, only those being considered will be contacted. At Cloudworks we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation or need this job posting in an accessible format, please contact us at info@cloudworks.co.

job_description:
Cloudworks is a leading cloud technology consulting firm supporting clients’ transitions to Cloud-based technologies, empowered by Robotic Process Automation. From strategy to execution we help organizations realize the art of possible by providing executable strategy, operations, technology, and advisory services. We provide advisory through end‑to‑end implementation services and are recognized in the marketplace for Cloud and RPA technology leadership.

Our experienced technology professionals offer deep technical experience in their area of focus and are committed to delivering efficient, technology-based solutions to our clients. Additionally, our professionals invest in our Clients’ success and the development of leading-edge RPA usage cases, improving our ability to tailor solutions to solve our Clients' business issues.

Why work with us

People

We are passionate about fostering a culture where people thrive. Our hiring process is very thorough to help ensure potential candidates are top talent, a good fit, and giving candidates a chance to understand if Cloudworks is a right fit for them too!

Teamwork

Investment

Unlike many consulting companies which rely on a semi-annual or annual performance review cycle, we believe in investing in our staff through feedback which happens much more in real-time. Oracle HCM Cloud Functional Payroll Consultant Lead

These are the typical questions that we help our clients answer. By harnessing the power of Oracle Cloud technology, we can help transform an organization through the latest social, mobile, HCM, ERP, and Financials solutions. We’re looking for someone who can join our team of professionals to help solve some of our clients' most critical problems.

Identify functionality gaps in Oracle HCM Cloud, and build extensions for them

Configure the Oracle HCM Cloud Applications to meet client requirements and document application set-ups
Write business requirement documents for reports, interfaces, data conversions, and application extensions for Oracle HCM Cloud projects

Assist client in preparing validation scripts, testing scenarios, and develop test scripts for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Support clients with the execution of test scripts
Validate configuration and data for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Lead migration of configuration, integrations, and extensions to Production for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Effectively communicate and drive project deliverables for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Complete tasks efficiently and in a timely manner
Interact with the project team members responsible for developing reports, interfaces, data conversion programs, and application extensions
Provide status and issue reports to the project manager/client on a regular basis
Share knowledge to continually improve implementation methodology for Oracle HCM Cloud projects
Work on Rel 12 and upwards
Access and assess impacts on Oracle’s quarterly release
Required

Functional professional with 3+ Oracle HCM Cloud Payroll implementations performing a Lead role
Experience providing HCM Cloud Payroll consulting services through the implementation delivery methodology lifecycle, including business process requirements, solution design and configuration, testing, production migration and support
Experience leading customers through Oracle delivered Payroll functionality, driving processes and solutions to industry best practices
Provide knowledge transfer to the Cloud Payroll process flow, configuration and Payroll process activities
Experience implementing some combination of Oracle HCM Modules such as HR, Benefits, Absences, Time & labor, Payroll, Talent Management, Learning, and Recruiting
Demonstrated experience as a resource leading the definition of systems strategy, gathering, and documenting business requirements, leading fit-gap analysis, as‑is and to‑be business process designs, prototypes, functional configuration, testing, and client user training
Experience reporting to senior client contacts, managing client teams, in addition to on- and off‑site, and off‑shore functional and technical teams
Excellent interpersonal, communication (oral and written) and presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, etc.)
Self-motivated and able to plan work effort and manage priorities
Ability to effectively work in a remote model with clients and peers
Demonstrated ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner
Limited travel required (project milestone based)
A Bachelor’s degree

Preferred

PHR, CCP, FPC, or CPP certification is a plus
Lead experience on complex, international, multi-currency, and multi-organization implementations
5+ years of consulting experience which includes: contributing to requests for proposals (RFP), client presentations, detailing the scope of work (SOW)
